intro: Pimelea decora, commonly known as the yellow bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble a bottlebrush. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with dense, cylindrical flower clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Pimelea decora thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
